alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 1:56PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains developing over the advisory areas. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with these heavy rains during the next couple of hours. These heavy rains could cause flooding over the area due to the grounds being saturated. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood WArning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kendall, Pinecrest, The Crossings, West Kendall, The Hammocks, Kendale Lakes, Country Walk, Richmond Heights, Zoo Miami, Richmond West, Intersection Krome And Kendall Drive, Sunset, West Perrine, Tamiami, Olympia Heights, Palmetto Bay, Glenvar Heights, Everglades National Park, Three Lakes and Kendall West. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
